result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Charles Worgull was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $300.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges, to provide DNA and pay costs and surcharge. Bail on deposit to apply and any balance owing is to be paid by the review date or a civil judgment shall be entered.

*The court ordered Defendant to serve 90 days in the HOC. The Defendant is to serve 2 days, credit for 1 day (to report Noon on Monday September 21) and the balance is stayed for review on 01/08/16 at 8:15.

**** 1-8-2016, Judge Jeffrey Wagner; Defendant has paid all costs as ordered on 9-15-2015 and shown proof to the court.  The court will STAY the balance of HOC time imposed.  No further action is required.****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Charles Worgull

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew Charles Worgull in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has paid all costs as ordered on 9-15-2015 and shown proof to the court.  The court will STAY the balance of HOC time imposed.  No further action is required.

Defendant Matthew Charles Worgull in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and additional statement by Catrina W-H.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  The defendant is to serve 2 days, credit for 1 day (to report Noon on Monday September 21) and the balance is STAYED for review on 1-8-2016 at 8:15.
The defendant is ordered to pay a fine of $300.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges, to provide DNA and pay costs and surcharge. BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY and any balance owing is to be paid by the review date ore a civil judgment shall be entered.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Matthew Charles Worgull in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
AS to count 1:  Court ordered count dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Case is adjourned to 9-15-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Matthew Charles Worgull in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with C.W. or her children AH or MH or the address of 9711 W Greenwood Tr, Milwaukee, WI, no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/13/2015
Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.W. dob 6-9-1973 or her children A.H., M.H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Charles Worgull in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/14/15 @ 1:30pm
